column4: i have php5 and libapache2-mod-php5 installed, and i've run a2enmod php5, but it still asks me to download php files when i try to navigate to them on my local apache server.  anyone know why?
and yes i've restarted it
have you restarted apache since enabling php5
yes
and are you using the right extension on the php file ?
.php.  i assume that's correct?
sounds good
if you do a sudo apache2 -l what modules are loaded ?
also show me the output of "sudo dpkg -l | grep libapache2-mod-php5"
http://codepad.org/1iMe68uz
look in Etcapache2/mods-enabled is the php5 files there and correctly linked to mods-available
sorry - that should be /etc/apache2/mods-enabled
it looks correct.  there's a .load and a .conf, neither link is broken
yup, looks good, could you paste the php file's contents then ?
(as in a pastebin please)
http://codepad.org/Oe13QJS2
oh, shit...apache gives some weird error message when it restarts.  didn't notice that before, thought it was just the usual one.  i should be able to figure it out from there
that all looks simple enough
control the language please
do you know what the error means ?
well, i should be able to figure it out.  something in the .conf.  thanks for the help
no problem, well spotted
